intro: Racosperma pycnostachyum, commonly known as the dense-stamen acacia, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, clustered pods that contain seeds, typical of the Acacia genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
